subject: JUnit 4 & logging
msgSnippet: Hi, I m a new user to JUnit and logging.  I ve decided to use the latest version of JUnit; version 4.  I have successfully created tests, and ran them using
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm a new user to JUnit and logging. I've decided to use the latest
version of JUnit; version 4. I have successfully created tests, and
ran them using Eclipse 3.2.1 (which supports JUnit 4).

I am also using logging in my system (logback 0.8.1, but log4J would
be fine too). Is there anyway that I can add the test summary
information to my log? I have been searching on the web and in J.
Rainsberger's book 'JUnit Recipes', but haven't come up with a viable
answer.

Log4Unit works with JUnit version 3.8.1, and so isn't compatible with
the new syntax of JUnit 4.

Does the answer maybe lie with Ant? Can I use Ant within Eclipse, and
to concatenate the test summary information to an already existing log
file?

Sample code would be great, if possible.

Thanks,
Deirdre
